meanings.definition: ヒドラジノ- (化学物質名に用いられる接頭辞で、ヒドラジン誘導体であることを示す)
meanings.english_definition: A chemical prefix indicating the presence of a hydrazine derivative.

etymology.value: Derived from hydrazine, by replacing a hydrogen atom with a bond to the main molecule.

usage_notes.explanation: Used in chemical nomenclature to indicate a derivative of hydrazine (N₂H₄) where one hydrogen atom has been replaced by a substituent.
